data.title: How can we keyframe zorder in CocosStudio ?
data.body: There is a class ZOrderFrame in Cocos2dx framework, But we can't find any way to keyframe ZOrder in Studio, need help.

data.title: Add performance tests project.
data.body:
1. Add a  project named performance-tests for automatically test performance.
2. Remove the performance test cases in cpp-tests project.

Now performance tests project only support platforms : iOS, Mac, Android & Win32.

data.title: Not able to set physics body for any sprite
data.body:
Hi ,
I am trying to set physics body for a sprite. Here is my code:
`auto physicsBody = PhysicsBody::createBox(Size(65.0f, 75.0f), PhysicsMaterial(0.1f, 1.0f, 0.0f));
 testSprite1->setPhysicsBody(physicsBody);`

I even followed the tutorial (http://jslim.net/blog/2014/10/10/cocos2d-x-v3-accurate-physics-body-shape-with-physicseditor/) and tried with physics editor but in both the ways my application is crashing in `void Node::updateTransformFromPhysics(const Mat4& parentTransform, uint32_t parentFlags)` at this line 
 `auto updateBodyTransform = _physicsWorld->_updateBodyTransform;`

data.title: Support Lua on Windows phone
data.body:
I would love to see Lua on Windows phone. We are in this process of porting our games, which are all written in Lua, to the platform and realized that Lua on the Windows phone platform is unsupported. 

I wouldn't mind doing the work to complete this. I wanted to know 1) who I can talk to help with this work? 2) does anyone know platform specific issues that may give me trouble when trying to port the Lua bindings? 3) has someone already started the work to complete this feature?

Also, I've heard talk about Windows Universal apps where the build process builds for all platforms. Is this work done? If it is, does that mean that Lua will work on the phone Without special build steps?

Any help would be appreciated. 

Thank you!

data.title: fix material clone
data.body: Material::clone doesn't set the parent correctly.

data.title: ClippingNode is not perfect and does not work in some cases
data.body:
Here are some issues found with clipping node:
1. ClippingNode fails to work if you have a nested ClippingNodes e.g. masked sprite in a scrollview, nested sprite masks
2. ClippingNode and label does not seem to work together. e.g. using label to mask a sprite does not work
3. ClippingNode does not seem to have a smooth output. Does it support alpha?

Pls add light map support for Sprite3D
cocos2dx 3.5 Cocos2dxActivity.runOnGLThread  can not work
data.body: Cocos2dxActivity.runOnGLThread  can not work  After replacing native activity with java activity, this function can not work correctly. with error "E/libEGL(7868): call to OpenGL ES API with no current context (logged once per thread)"

data.title: Support load rotation in tile map objects
Android build script should allow linking of specific jars and build targets
data.body:
Right now cocos-console compile androids with everything in proj.android/libs/
Sometimes I want to place both test and release version of a lib in libs, and I just can't do that with current setup.

data.title: Pooled action classes
data.body: Action classes are frequently used. It should be automatically pooled, according to some settings probably, to avoid frequent allocations.

data.title: Add native localization support
data.body: Localization should be an integrated part of the game engine and provides ease to use interface. Right now common hacks are employed, like reading key strings from an external spreadsheet, replacing UI widget text by hand. It's inconvenient and hard to maintain. A locale setting should be allowed with hooks embedded in common widget classes.

data.title: cocostudio supports export filter
data.body: Sometimes I want to do some extra processing(convert certain image formats) before exporting the file. Cocostudio should allow external scripts to be executed when publishing.

data.title: cocostudio adds webp support
data.body: webp format provides great compression and cocos2d-x supports it. We see really good results using webp. No reason the editor does not support it.
